action.action-desc: Mr. Byrne introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Oversight and Government Reform

form.official-title: To abolish certain executive agencies unless Congress disapproves of such abolishment, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Sunset Inefficient and Unaccountable Government Act.

subsection.text: Each agency listed in subsection (c) shall be abolished on the date set forth in subsection (c), unless a Federal law disapproving of the abolishment of the agency is enacted before such date.

When an agency is abolished under this Act, the head of such agency may take such actions as are necessary to dispose of the assets, obligations, and liabilities of the agency during the one-year period that begins on the date of such abolishment.

paragraph.text: The date of abolishment referred to in subsection (a) is 2 years after the date of enactment of this Act for the following agencies:

clause.text: about which Congress has not passed a concurrent resolution disapproving of the abolishment of such agency during the previous 10 years; and
whose authorizing legislation was referred to the Committee on Agriculture of the House of Representatives.

paragraph.header: Transportation; Armed Services; Foreign Affairs; Homeland Security
paragraph.text: The date of abolishment referred to in subsection (a) is 11 years after the date of enactment of this Act for the following agencies:

subparagraph.text: Any other agency, except the Department of Homeland Security—

clause.text: about which Congress has not passed a concurrent resolution disapproving of the abolishment of such agency during the previous 10 years; and

subparagraph.text: Any other agency, except the Department of Defense, the Department of State, the Department of Homeland Security, the Department of Justice, and the Department of the Treasury, about which Congress has not passed a concurrent resolution disapproving of the abolishment of such agency within the last 10 years.

subsection.text: On the date that is 10 years after each date listed in subsection (c) for the abolishment of an agency, and every 10 years thereafter, if such agency exists, such agency shall be abolished.

section.text: Not later 1 year before the date on which an agency is scheduled to be abolished pursuant to section 2(a), the head of such agency shall submit to Congress a report on the roles and responsibilities of the agency detailing the agency’s justification for existence, including areas where the duties of the agency may overlap with the duties of other agencies.
The term agency has the meaning given the term Executive agency in section 105 of title 5, United States Code.
